intro: Cirsium apiculatum, commonly known as the lesser thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring spiny leaves and purple to pink flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped with rough, serrated edges and a hairy texture. Cirsium apiculatum thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides.
